np.size.rowcol.description: for the size parameter as 2D-Array, use tuple

np.array.zeros.description: size of array using numpy set to 0, [pip3 install numpy]

np.array.ones.body: ${1:varB}__A = np.ones(${2:size}, dtype=${3:int})  # import numpy as np
np.array.ones.description: size of array using numpy set to 1, [pip3 install numpy]

np.array.fill.body: ${1:varC}__A = np.fill(${2:size}, dtype=${3:int})  # import numpy as np
np.array.fill.description: size of array using numpy set to custom, [pip3 install numpy]

np.array.random.body: ${1:varD}__A = np.random.random(${2:size}, dtype=${3:int})  # import numpy as np
np.array.random.description: size of array using numpy set to random, [pip3 install numpy]

np.array.body: ${1:varF}__A = np.array(${2:list}, dtype=${3:int})  # import numpy as np

np.array.arange.body: ${1:varG}__A = np.arange(${2:Start}, ${3:ExclusiveEnd}, ${4:Step}, dtype=${5:int})  # import numpy as np
np.array.arange.description: array element range using numpy set to 0, [pip3 install numpy]

np.array.linspace.body: ${1:varH}__A = np.linspace(${2:Start}, ${3:InclusiveEnd}, ${4:Size}, dtype=${5:int})  # import numpy as np
np.array.linspace.description: array total with start and ending using numpy set to 0, [pip3 install numpy]

np.array.length.row.description: Get the total row of an array

np.array.length.col.description: Get the total col of an array

np.array.size.description: Get the total elements count of an array

np.array.shape.description: Get the dimension of an array

np.array.reshape.description: change the dimension of an array, will not make a copy

body: for r in varExamp__A:  # looping through row
for c in r:  # loop through column since array is sequence
